alert.note: Alert for Debeque to Silt Corridor; Grand Valley (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued October 24 at 4:20AM MDT until October 24 at 10:00AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM MDT THIS MORNING... ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM MDT THIS MORNING... ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 10 AM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the first Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 26. For the second Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 24 expected. For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility down to 1/4 mile in dense fog. * WHERE...Grand Valley and Debeque to Silt Corridor. * WHEN...For the first Freeze Warning, until 10 AM MDT this morning. For the second Freeze Warning, from 2 AM to 10 AM MDT Tuesday. For the Dense Fog Advisory, until 10 AM MDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility and freezing temperatures on wet roads.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing. If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you.

area.areaDesc: Debeque to Silt Corridor; Grand Valley
